author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

> @SkyWorld117 note that usually regular Julia packages don't have underscores in their names (it isn't forbidden to use them, but the ecosystem is _very_ consistent about this). Also, the description of the package says this is more a personal experiment than something for other to use? If so, I wouldn't recommend to register the package, which can always be installed with
> 
> ```
> ]add <URL>
> ```

Thank you for your comment, I will rename the package later. I want to register this package since it is working well and I am developing it quite often. The description is kind of warning because I am just a high school student and I learn the knowledge by myself, the others should know something about that and what they can expect.
